Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

At the ACLU, our mission is not only to protect civil liberties, but to advance them. We have serious problems in West Virginia. The time for half measures is over. We need big, bold ideas if we want to live up to the ideals embodied in our stateâ€™s motto — montani semper liberi. We recently unveiled three campaigns to guide our work for the next decade, focusing on juvenile justice reform, criminal justice reform, and defending democracy.

These campaigns are an effort to fulfill a long-term vision in which mountaineers truly are always free.

To kick off our campaigns, we are spending two weeks traveling around the state to talk about the important work we will be undertaking. At these events, you will hear from Executive Director Joseph Cohen, and Policy Director Eli Baumwell about our vision, our plans, and how you can get involved.

Join us in the following locations:

Wheeling
Monday, July 15, 6:30 - 8 p.m.

Morgantown
Tuesday, July 16, 6 - 7:30 p.m.

Shepherdstown
Wednesday, July 17, 6 - 7:30 p.m.

Lewisburg
Thursday, July 18, 6 - 7:30 p.m.

Charleston
Monday, July 22, 6 - 7:30 p.m.

Huntington
Tuesday, July 23, 6 - 7:30 p.m.

Parkersburg
Wednesday, July 24, 6 - 7:30 p.m.

Buckhannon
Thursday, July 25, 6 - 7:30 p.m.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of West Virginia
